definition: the Americas/abbr. for 美洲[Mei3 zhou1]/USA/abbr. for 美國|美国[Mei3 guo2]
beautiful/very satisfactory/good/to beautify/to be pleased with oneself

sentences.english: Therefore silk is known as "second-skin body" of reputation.
sentences.chinese: 因而蚕丝素有“人体第二肌肤”之美誉。

sentences.english: This area enjoys the reputation of a land with milk and honey.
sentences.chinese: 这个地方有鱼米之乡的美誉。

sentences.english: Zhangzhou enjoys a reputation of "A Land of Flowers and Fruits".
sentences.chinese: 漳州素有“花果之乡”的美誉。

sentences.english: He started a pig farm, which had the reputation of being one of the cleanest in the United States.
sentences.chinese: 他建了一家养猪厂，在全美国有最干净的猪厂的美誉。

sentences.english: The higher education from tests the test to be known as "the first under heaven to test" the fine reputation.
sentences.chinese: 高等教育自考考试素有“天下第一考”之美誉。

sentences.english: And therefore Jiaxiang has garned a good fame:the land of Lu Brocade.
sentences.chinese: 因而，嘉祥素有“鲁锦之乡”的美誉。

sentences.english: Wuzhizhou enjoy the reputation of "China's first diving base."
sentences.chinese: 蜈支洲岛享有“中国第一潜水基地”美誉。

sentences.english: Shiwan is the pottery capital of southern China with a history as long as Chinese civilization.
sentences.chinese: 石湾镇，历史悠久，素有“南国陶都”的美誉。

sentences.english: The lacquer industry deals with a natural resinous varnish, which is always acknowledged as the "King of Coating."
sentences.chinese: 漆业是天然树脂涂料，素有“涂料之王”的美誉。

sentences.english: Su Zhou Newasia Technologies Inc has widely popularity and reputation.
sentences.chinese: 公司拥有广泛的知名度和美誉度。

sentences.english: Both credit and reputation are pursuit goals of our company forever.
sentences.chinese: 信誉度和美誉度的双赢是我公司不孜的追求目标。

sentences.english: Brazil benefits from a relatively better reputation on corruption.
sentences.chinese: 巴西从腐败相对较少的美誉中获益。

sentences.english: In the industry enjoyed a high profile and reputation.
sentences.chinese: 在行业内享有很高的知名度和美誉度。

sentences.english: University is renowned as the best university south of the Yangtze River.
sentences.chinese: 复旦大学享有“江南第一学府”的美誉。

sentences.english: Our company has little market presence or reputation.
sentences.chinese: 我们公司现在没有市场份额和市场的美誉度。

sentences.english: Turks and Caicos have built a reputation as an offshore financial center. Paul Adams reports.
sentences.chinese: 特克斯和凯科斯群岛素有离岸金融中心的美誉。

definition: to dub with a nice-sounding appellation/fanciful moniker
to acclaim/to sing the praises of
to be famous far and wide (idiom)
to make a name/to become famous
seasoned/honed to perfection over centuries/special reserve
to become known far and wide (idiom)/famous
to be known as/to be nicknamed/to be purportedly/to claim (often exaggeratedly or falsely)
